Like a guided nature walk, cultivate spaces that teach listening, critical thinking, and restorative repair—balancing open inquiry with predictable, consistently applied standards so people learn to engage respectfully across differences.
statements.490: Campuses should vigorously defend free expression while enforcing clear, content-neutral rules that prevent harassment and protect the ability to learn. Consistent due process, practical restorative practices, and education in critical thinking and civil discourse can turn conflict into instruction rather than division. That balanced, common-sense approach preserves academic freedom while safeguarding the dignity and safety of the community.
